pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:0.5.eng: 85. The training rule on entering an inhabited area at the wrong time

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitvā sabhāyaṃ nisīditvā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathenti, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the village at the wrong time, sat down in the public meeting hall, and talked about all sorts of worldly things:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.3.pli: rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ senākathaṃ bhayakathaṃ yuddhakathaṃ annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ gāmakathaṃ nigamakathaṃ nagarakathaṃ janapadakathaṃ itthikathaṃ sūrakathaṃ visikhākathaṃ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṃ pubbapetakathaṃ nānattakathaṃ lokakkhāyikaṃ samuddakkhāyikaṃ itibhavābhavakathaṃ iti vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.3.eng: about kings, gangsters, and officials; about armies, dangers, and battles; about food, drink, clothes, and beds; about garlands and perfumes; about relatives, vehicles, villages, towns, and countries; about women and heroes; gossip; about the departed; about various trivialities; about the world and the sea; about the various kinds of existence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitvā sabhāyaṃ nisīditvā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathessanti, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.5.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics enter the village at the wrong time, sit down in the public meeting hall, and talk about such worldly things?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.7.pli: itibhavābhavakathaṃ iti vā, seyyathāpi gihī kāmabhogino”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.7.eng: They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.8.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.9.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.9.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitvā sabhāyaṃ nisīditvā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathessanti, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.10.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitvā sabhāyaṃ nisīditvā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathetha, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitvā sabhāyaṃ nisīditvā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathessatha, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.18.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.22.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.22.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.23.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu vikāle gāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.23.1.eng: ‘If a monk enters an inhabited area at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.24.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.24.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchantā sāyaṃ aññataraṃ gāmaṃ upagacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of monks were walking through the Kosalan country on their way to Sāvatthī, when one evening they came to a certain village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.5.pli: “bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitun”ti kukkuccāyantā na pavisiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.5.eng: But knowing that entering a village at the wrong time had been prohibited by the Buddha and being afraid of wrongdoing, they declined.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.7.eng: They then went to Sāvatthī and told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.8.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.10.eng: “Monks, I allow you to enter an inhabited area at the wrong time after informing someone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.11.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.11.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.12.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk, without informing anyone, enters an inhabited area at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.13.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.13.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchanto sāyaṃ aññataraṃ gāmaṃ upagacchi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.eng: Soon afterwards a monk was walking through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī, when one evening he came to a certain village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.5.pli: “bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitun”ti kukkuccāyanto na pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.5.eng: But knowing that entering a village at the wrong time without informing anyone had been prohibited by the Buddha and being afraid of wrongdoing, he declined.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.7.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.7.eng: He then went to Sāvatthī and told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.8.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.10.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, santaṃ bhikkhuṃ āpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ pavisituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.10.eng: “Monks, I allow you to enter an inhabited area at the wrong time after informing an available monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.11.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.11.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.12.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk, when a monk is available, enters an inhabited area at the wrong time without informing him, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.13.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.13.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu ahinā daṭṭho hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.eng: Soon afterwards a monk was bitten by a snake.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.2.eng: Another monk went to the village to get fire.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.4.pli: “bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ pavisitun”ti kukkuccāyanto na pāvisi …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.4.eng: that the Buddha has prohibited entering a village at the wrong time without informing an available monk. And being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not enter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.4.comm: The ellipses points are not found in the PTS version. In fact, the ellipses points do not fit, since they imply that the monk gets robbed (as above), which does not fit the context. I therefore follow the PTS punctuation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.7.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tathārūpe accāyike karaṇīye santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ pavisituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.7.eng: “Monks, I allow you to enter an inhabited area at the wrong time without informing an available monk if there is some appropriate urgent business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.8.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.8.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.9.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ paviseyya, aññatra tathārūpā accāyikā karaṇīyā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.9.1.eng: ‘If a monk, when another monk is available, enters an inhabited area at the wrong time without informing him, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.6.eng: he is able to inform him and then enter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.8.eng: he is not able to inform anyone and then enter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.10.eng: when the middle of the day has passed, until dawn.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.12.pli: parikkhittassa gāmassa parikkhepaṃ atikkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.12.eng: if he crosses the boundary of an enclosed inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.13.pli: Aparikkhittassa gāmassa upacāraṃ okkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.13.eng: If he enters the vicinity of an unenclosed inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.14.eng: Except if there is some appropriate urgent business:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.15.eng: unless there is some appropriate urgent business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.1.pli: Vikāle vikālasaññī santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā gāmaṃ pavisati, aññatra tathārūpā accāyikā karaṇīyā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.1.eng: If it is the wrong time, and he perceives it as such, and he enters an inhabited area without informing an available monk, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.2.pli: Vikāle vematiko santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā gāmaṃ pavisati, aññatra tathārūpā accāyikā karaṇīyā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.2.eng: If it is the wrong time, but he is unsure of it, and he enters an inhabited area without informing an available monk, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.3.pli: Vikāle kālasaññī santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā gāmaṃ pavisati, aññatra tathārūpā accāyikā karaṇīyā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.3.eng: If it is the wrong time, but he perceives it as the right time, and he enters an inhabited area without informing an available monk, except if there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.4.eng: If it is the right time, but he perceives it as the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.5.eng: If it is the right time, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.6.eng: If it is the right time, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.2.eng: if there is some appropriate urgent business;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.3.eng: if he enters after informing an available monk;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.4.eng: if he enters without informing anyone when there is no available monk;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.5.eng: if he is going between monasteries;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.6.eng: if he is going to the dwelling place of nuns;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.7.eng: if he is going to the dwelling place of the monastics of another religion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.8.eng: if he is returning to the monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.9.eng: if the road goes via an inhabited area;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.12.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.13.eng: The training rule on entering an inhabited area at the wrong time, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:0.5.eng: 86. The training rule on needle cases

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena dantakārena bhikkhū pavāritā honti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.2.eng: At that time an ivory-worker had invited the monks

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.3.eng: who needed needle cases to ask for one.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bahū sūcighare viññāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.4.eng: And the monks asked for many needle cases.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.5.pli: Yesaṃ khuddakā sūcigharā te mahante sūcighare viññāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.5.eng: Those who had small needle cases asked for large ones,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.6.pli: Yesaṃ mahantā sūcigharā te khuddake sūcighare viññāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.6.eng: and those who had large needle cases asked for small ones.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.7.pli: Atha kho so dantakāro bhikkhūnaṃ bahū sūcighare karonto na sakkoti aññaṃ vikkāyikaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ kātuṃ, attanāpi na yāpeti, puttadāropissa kilamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.7.eng: The ivory-worker was so busy making needle cases for the monks that he was unable to make goods for sale. He could not make a living for himself, and his wives and children suffered.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.9.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics not have any sense of moderation and ask for many needle cases?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.10.pli: Ayaṃ imesaṃ bahū sūcighare karonto na sakkoti aññaṃ vikkāyikaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ kātuṃ, attanāpi na yāpeti, puttadāropissa kilamatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.10.eng: This ivory-worker is so busy making needle cases for them that he’s unable to make goods for sale. He can’t make a living for himself, and his wives and children are suffering.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.11.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.11.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.12.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.12.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.13.eng: “How can those monks not have a sense of moderation and ask for many needle cases?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.17.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.19.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.20.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu aṭṭhimayaṃ vā dantamayaṃ vā visāṇamayaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ kārāpeyya bhedanakaṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a monk has a needle case made from bone, ivory, or horn, it is to be destroyed, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.1.8.eng: elephant tooth is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.1.12.pli: karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.1.12.eng: if he makes one or has one made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.1.13.eng: When he gets it, it is to be destroyed, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.2.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.2.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.3.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.3.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.4.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.4.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.5.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.5.eng: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.6.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.2.6.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.3.3.eng: if it is a fire kindler;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.3.5.eng: if it is an ointment box;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.3.6.eng: if it is an ointment stick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.3.7.eng: if it is an adz handle;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.3.8.eng: if it is a water wiper;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc86:2.3.11.eng: The training rule on needle cases, the fourth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.5.eng: 87. The training rule on beds and benches

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto ucce mañce sayati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.2.eng: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan was sleeping on a high bed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto yenāyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa vihāro tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.3.eng: On one occasion, as the Buddha and a number of monks were walking about the dwellings, they came to Upananda’s dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.4.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.6.eng: “Sir, please come and see my bed.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tatova paṭinivattitvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.7.eng: The Buddha turned around on the spot and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.8.eng: “A fool, monks, can be recognized by his sleeping place.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.9.eng: After rebuking Upananda in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.10.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.11.1.pli: “Navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭhaṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugataṅgulena, aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā; taṃ atikkāmayato chedanakaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a monk is having a new bed or bench made, it is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame. If the legs exceed that, they are to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.11.1.comm: For an explanation of rendering sugata as “standard”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.2.eng: newly made is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.4.pli: cattāro mañcā— masārako, bundikābaddho, kuḷīrapādako, āhaccapādako.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.4.eng: there are four kinds of beds: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.4.comm: For a discussion of these and those below, see Appendix of Furniture.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.6.pli: cattāri pīṭhāni— masārakaṃ, bundikābaddhaṃ, kuḷīrapādakaṃ, āhaccapādakaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.6.eng: there are four kinds of benches: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.8.eng: making it himself or having it made.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.9.pli: Aṭṭhaṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugataṅgulena, aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyāti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.9.eng: It is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.11.pli: taṃ atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ, paṭilābhena chinditvā pācittiyaṃ desetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.11.eng: If he makes one, or has one made, that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct. When he gets it, the legs are to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.12.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.12.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.13.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.13.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.14.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.14.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.15.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.15.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.16.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.16.eng: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.17.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.17.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.2.eng: if he makes it the right height;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.3.eng: if he makes it lower than the right height;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.4.pli: aññena kataṃ pamāṇātikkantaṃ paṭilabhitvā chinditvā paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.4.eng: if he gets one made by another that exceeds the right height and then cuts the legs down before using it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.7.eng: The training rule on beds and benches, the fifth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:0.5.eng: 88. The training rule on upholstered with cotton down

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mañcampi pīṭhampi tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six had beds and benches made upholstered with cotton down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.3.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā mañcampi pīṭhampi tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpessanti, seyyathāpi gihī kāmabhogino”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics have beds and benches made upholstered with cotton down? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mañcampi pīṭhampi tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.7.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six do this?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, mañcampi pīṭhampi tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, mañcampi pīṭhampi tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.14.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpeyya, uddālanakaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk has a bed or a bench made upholstered with cotton down, it is to be stripped, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.6.pli: cattāro mañcā— masārako, bundikābaddho, kuḷīrapādako, āhaccapādako.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.6.eng: there are four kinds of beds: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.6.comm: For a discussion of these and those below, see Appendix of Furniture.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.8.pli: cattāri pīṭhāni— masārakaṃ, bundikābaddhaṃ, kuḷīrapādakaṃ, āhaccapādakaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.8.eng: there are four kinds of benches: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.10.eng: there are three kinds of cotton down: cotton down from trees, cotton down from creepers, cotton down from grass.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.12.pli: karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.12.eng: if he makes one or has one made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.13.eng: When he gets it, it is to be stripped, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.14.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.14.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.15.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.15.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.16.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.16.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.17.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.17.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.18.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.18.eng: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.19.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.19.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.2.eng: if it is for a back-and-knee strap;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.2.comm: The āyoga is used as a support for the pallattikā sitting posture. See Bhikkhu Ñāṇatusita, “Analysis of the Bhikkhu Pātimokkha”, p. 259, (re. Bu Sk 26:1.3.1).

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.3.eng: if it is for a belt;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.4.eng: if it is for a shoulder strap;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.5.eng: if it is for a bowl bag;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.6.eng: if it is for a water filter;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.7.eng: if he is making a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.8.eng: if he gets one made by another and then strips it before using it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.11.eng: The training rule on upholstered with cotton down, the sixth, is finished.
